SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

pdqninja.pdq
Annotation Type Shared

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=PARAMETER)
public @interface Shared

Indicates that the argument will be shared across the multiple parallel or distributed instantiations of the computation.

The methods that have been annotated as @Parallel can optionally annotate their arguments as @Shared to indicate that these arguments are shared across the different threads or processes.

If the shared object is mutable, it is the responsibility of the programmer to properly ensure that it is safely accessed by different threads (for example, by synchronizing access to the shared resources, using concurrent data structures, etc).

In distributed execution mode, the shared objects are serialized and transmitted to PDQWorkers on the remote machines. If running in distributed mode, ensure that the shared objects are serializable. Note also that whereas the shared objects are sent to the workers they are never received back during or after the computation is finished. So a computation that relies on the visibility of changes made by one thread to shared objects at the other threads will probably not work correctly in the distributed mode.

The annotation must not be applied to the first argument of the method.
